class shared.StatusCodes[source]¶

Namespace for descriptive status codes, for code readability

– HTTP Status Codes – Original Idea From: flask_api :ref RFC2616: http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html :ref RFC6585: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6585

… examples of possible future sections … – MYSQL Error Codes – – SERVER Status Codes – – KAMAILIO Error Codes – – RTPENGINE Error Codes –

shared.getRequestData()[source]¶

Get data from request formatted as dict

Must be run within request context

The following data formats are supported:

  • multipart forms

  • url encoded forms

  • JSON body

Returns

request data

Return type

dict

shared.hostToIP(host)[source]¶

Convert host to IP Address

Supports conversion to IPv4 and IPv6

IPv4 takes priority and is tried first

Returns

IP address of host

str|None

shared.parseGenericUri(uri)[source]¶

Parse Generic URI into its components (as generic as possible)

Port is the only part type casted (parse delimited fields accordingly)

components dict format:

res = {
    'proto': <str|None>,
    'userpw': <str|None>,
    'ipv6': <str|None>,
    'ipv4': <str|None>,
    'host': <str|None>,
    'port': <int|None>,
    'path': <str|None>,
    'params': <str|None>
}
Parameters

uri (str) – URI to parse

Returns

components of URI

Return type

dict|None

    'port': <int|None>,
    'params': <dict|None>
}

Returns

components of SIP URI

Return type

dict|None

shared.redirectCustom(location, *render_args, code=302, response_cb=None, force_redirect=False)[source]¶

Combines functionality of werkzeug.utils.redirect() with flask.templating.render_template() to allow for virtual redirection to an endpoint with any HTTP status code.

  1. render template at a custom url (doesn’t have to be an endpoint)

    def index():

    return redirectCustom(‘http://localhost:5000/notfound’, render_template(‘not_found.html’), code=404)

    def index():

    html = ‘<h1>Are you lost {{ username }}?</h1>’ return redirectCustom(url_for(‘notfound’), render_template_string(html), username=’john’, code=404)

  2. customizing the response before sending to the client

    def index():
    def addAuthHeaders(response):

    response.headers[‘Access-Control-Allow-Origin’ = ‘*’ response.headers[‘Access-Control-Allow-Headers’] = ‘origin, x-requested-with, content-type’ response.headers[‘Access-Control-Allow-Methods’] = ‘PUT, GET, POST, DELETE, OPTIONS’

    return redirectCustom(url_for(‘login’), render_template(‘login_custom.html’), code=403, response_cb=addAuthHeaders)

  3. redirecting with a custom HTTP status code (normally restricted to 300’s)

    def index():

    return redirectCustom(url_for(‘http://localhost:5000/error’), showError())

  4. forcing redirection when client normally would ignore location header

    def index():

    return redirectCustom(url_for(showError), showError(), code=500, force_redirect=True)

Note

the endpoint logic is only executed when a the view function is passed in render_args

Parameters

  • location – the location the response should virtually redirect to

  • render_args – the return value from a view / template rendering function

  • code – the return HTTP status code, defaults to 302 like a normal redirect

  • response_cb – callback function taking werkzeug.wrappers.Response object as arg and returning edited response

  • force_redirect – whether to force redirection on client, only needed when client ignores location header

Returns

client viewable werkzeug.wrappers.Response object

shared.rowToDict(row)[source]¶

converts sqlalchemy row object to python dict does not recurse through relationships tries table data, then _asdict() method, then objToDict()

shared.safeFormatSipUri(uri, default_proto='sip', default_user='', default_port=5060, default_params={})[source]¶

Given a SIP URI of questionable validity, parse out the good stuff, and fill in the rest

Parameters

  • uri (str) – URI to format / validate

  • default_proto (str) – default protocol if missing

  • default_user (str) – default user if missing

  • default_port (int) – default port if missing

  • default_params (dict) – default SIP parameters

Returns

SIP URI safely formatted

Return type

str|None

shared.safeStripPort(address)[source]¶

Strip port from address

Properly strips on IPv6, IPv4, and FQDN addresses

Parameters

address (str) – address to strip port from

Returns

address with port stripped

Return type

str

shared.safeUriToHost(uri, default_port=None)[source]¶

Strips non-host parts and converges on the host

Supports IPv4, IPv6, and FQDN addresses as the host

Optionally formats with port if default port is set

Parameters

  • uri (str) – uri to extract host from

  • default_port (int) – default port if not found

Returns

host or host:port if port set

Return type

str|None
